column1: looped up and Babar finds turn with the new ball. No shot offered
dropped short and outside off, Roy rocks back and thumps it away to the midwicket boundary
sliding into the pads, nudged to leg for one
skids on outside off, and beats the attempted cut
tossed outside off, Zaman comes down the track and drills it over the bowler's head
just short of a good length and outside off, drags a pull behind square on the leg side
good length and outside off, Roy leans back and creams the ball to point
pitched up and angling away outside off, Zaman presses forward and jabs the ball to mid-off
bail-high short ball on off, Roy sits back and dispatches it to the midwicket boundary with a pull. The boundary ruins the over
uses his feet and pokes the ball to point
tossed up and angling down the leg side, Roy skips out, and does not meet the pitch. The ball grazes the pad and rolls away fine on the leg side
Roy pre-meditates, goes for a reverse-sweep and nails the ball from the stumps. Sends it over point
Roy hits the repeat button now. Tossed outside leg, Roy fetches it from there and reverses-swats it over point again
very full on the stumps, non-turning ball, push-driven to mid-on
Roy jumps down the track, takes a half-volley, and belts it down the ground
full-toss outside off, driven straight to extra cover
yorker on leg stump, dug back to the bowler
mighty full on the leg stump, forced to long-on. Front-foot no-ball from Anwar
half-volley on middle, free-hit, Roy does not need any second invitations. He launches it over the long-on boundary. Monster hit
length ball on middle stump, Roy clears his front leg again and blasts the ball over midwicket now. Back-to-back sixes. Lahore off to a flying start in Sharjah
slower full ball outside off, Zaman leans into the drive and laces the ball in the gap  between covers and mid-off
another slower cutter outside off, dabbed towards point with soft hands
112ks slower ball on off stump, Roy picks it and hoists it over the straight boundary. Thisara can't stop the bleeding
short of a length on middle and leg, flapped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, shovelled away with the bottom hand to wide long-on
back of the hand slower ball on middle and leg, tapped towards midwicket
short ball, darted in at leg stump, pulled to mid-on
dragged short on middle and leg, he goes over the top. Pulled over mid-on
Roy backs away outside the leg stump, Nawaz follows him. Punched down to long-on
fractionally short on off, Roy slugs it with all his might over midwicket
Fifty off 24 balls for Roy. Shovel-pulled away to deep midwicket. Stop him if you can
Zaman skips down the track, meets the pitch, and belts it straight past the bowler
dropped short on off stump, pulled powerfully to wide long-on
down the track and works a length ball into the vacant spaces on the leg side
flighted on the leg stump or just outside, reverse-slapped straight to point

Hasan produces the breakthrough for Quetta. Sir Viv is pleased in the dug out. Slides in with the arm as opposed to turning away. Full delivery, Roy eyes up the leg side but misses the big swipe. Hasan hits the off stump and celebrates
pushed through on middle, defended
Zaman gallops down the track and drills a very full ball to long-on
slides on outside off, leans back and chops to backward point
Zaman uses his feet again, Mahmudullah drags his length back outside off. Smeared over extra-cover
picked off the pads through backward square leg
slower offbreak, dabbed with the turn to midwicket
dropped short and outside off, leans back and cuts square through the off side
tossed up outside off, driven on the front foot to long-off
flatter and just a shade outside off, Zaman drops to one knee and drags a slog-sweep to deep midwicket
full and angled in on off, clipped away to deep midwicket running to is left
Umar comes down the track, takes it on the half-volley, and pumps it over the covers
Umar uses his feet again, the bowler shortens his length. Punched to cover
full, straight ball, knocked down to long-on
good length ball on middle and leg, Umar hangs back and clips through midwicket
Zaman uses his feet and nearly chips a return catch
Zaman skips out, this is a full-toss on the leg stump, he opens the face and drives to long-off
more round-arm than normal, angled in full, whipped away to cow corner
98ks dart, Babar hurled it flatter, seeing Zaman step out. Sarfraz does not collect the ball cleanly. He swipes the bails on the second attempt, but by then Zaman is safe
tossed up on off, Umar rushes down the track and dumps Hasan over his head. The runs continue to flow
uses his feet, Hasan pulls his length back. Umar checks his drive and chips in front of cover
fractionally short and outside off, chopped to backward point. Mix-up between the wickets, Zaman is nearly halfway down the pitch. Umar isn't interested. Zaman has enough time to hustle back
Umar comes down the track again, this time he is cramped for room. He attempts a wild swing and only miscues it to Mahmudullah at long-on
full and drifts in, blocked back to the bowler
full, grips in the surface, and spins away outside off, forward-defensive to cover
full and wide outside off, Zaman, having come down the track early, reaches out and ends up scything the ball over point
back of a length and outside off, sliced away to point
back of a length and outside off, cuts and can't beat Shehzad at point again
much fuller and outside off, Rizwan allows the ball to come to him, then opens the face and runs it down to third man
back of a length and outside off, flashed on the back foot to extra cover
good length and outside off, dragged away with the bottom hand to wide long-on
comes down the track and hammers a full ball to long-off
uses his feet and clips it away to wide long-on
fired on the pads, whipped to long-on
shortish and outside off, unleashes a clubbing swing and sends the ball soaring over wide long-on
uses his feet yorks himself and jabs to cover
tossed up and outside off, Zaman hares down the track, but is nowhere close to the pitch. Hoicks at the ball and picks out Shehzad at deep midwicket. No fifty for Zaman
really full on off, driven back to Babar
fired into the pads, clipped to midwicket
full on off, stabbed back to the bowler
much loopier and outside off, gently pushed back to the bowler
backs away outside leg, opens up the off side and drives inside-out to long-off
flatter on off, chopped from there to short third man
back of a length on leg stump, forced away to deep midwicket
Rizwan skips out, the bowler holds this full ball back. Check-pushed to long-off
yorker on middle, jammed down to long-off
Rizwan finally makes good connection. He charges down the track, gets a half-volley on off stump, and lofts it over the bowler's head for a six
slides on with the arm on off, Rizwan hangs back and plays it back to the bowler
good length and angled in on middle from around the stumps, hangs back and clips through midwicket

tossed up just a shade outside off, Rizwan skies a slog sweep in the air. Deep square leg runs across, Hasan I think, attempts the catch, but loses his balance and tumbles over the boundary. He, however, had the presence of mind to tip the ball into the playing field before going over. Deep midwicket tore to his right. Nearly a relay catch
down the track and slogged in the direction of deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, flashed away to extra cover
faster on off stump, punched away to wide long-off
slower through the air on off stump, Rizwan drops to one knee and smites a slog-sweep. Puts Mahmudullah into the stands beyond midwicket
drifting down the leg side, picked up and swept over short fine leg
length and outside off, smeared over midwicket for another six
short and outside off, pulled away on the back foot. Deep midwicket dives to his right to stop the ball, parrying it to wide long-on
shortish on leg stump, swiped to deep midwicket
Bisects deep midwicket and long-on. Rizwan comes down the track, and slams a short ball away. Hits the ad cushions on the flush. It's a six
very full on middle and leg, whipped through midwicket
leg-stump yorker, which is squeezed away to long-on
full on leg stump from around the wicket, Rizwan paddles it down to fine leg
Perera errs in line and length. Full and sliding down the leg side, Delport picks it up and whips into the stands beyond square leg
low full-toss on the stumps, shovelled to long-on
length ball on off stump, slogged away to deep midwicket
full-toss on off, Delport backs away, lines it up and dispatches it over the bowler's head. 200 on for Lahore
Delport backs away outside leg, this is probably a slower ball. Under-edged beside the stumps on the off side
Rizwan aims to slog-sweep over midwicket, ends up skewing the ball to point
length ball on middle and leg stumps, hacked to deep midwicket
short ball on off stump, chest-high delivery. Cramps Rizwan for room. But he still swats it away to the square-leg boundary
full and wide outside off, Delport backs away, swishes and misses
yorker just outside leg, grazes the pad and rolls fine
comes down the track, meets a full-toss, and bashes it over the top, clearing a leaping deep midwicket
full on off, plonks his front leg forward and swipes to deep midwicket
low full-toss outside off, forced to long-off. Lahore finish with 200
just short of a good length and outside off, Shehzad chops on the back foot to point
back of a length and outside off, Shehzad stylishly drives on the back foot, splitting cover-point and extra-cover. Top shot
good length ball on off stump, played back to the bowler
leg-stump half-volley, whipped away to deep midwicket
short of a length on off, skids on to rap the thigh. He looks to work it across the line and does not connect
full on middle, driven on the front foot to the left of mid-on
non-turning length-ball offbreak, worked on the back foot to the leg side
pushed through on middle, no turn, beats the inside edge, but swings in the air and raps the pad in front of middle. Was it heading down leg? Not given. I thought that would go onto hit the stumps
full on off, clipped through midwicket
back of a length and angled in, twirled through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, hoicked across the line over wide mid-on
throat-high short ball just outside off, cramps Nasim for room. He shimmies out, pulls and top-edges it in the air. Rizwan, the keeper, tracks down the skier
hip-high short ball on off, picked off through midwicket
full on off, KP is off the king pair with a little nudge to the leg side
shortish and outside off, Shehzad throws his bat at it and scythes it to the third man boundary
pitched up and outside off, driven to mid-off
knuckle ball goes the other way outside off, dabbed to point
pushed through on a length outside off, tapped to cover
really full on off, Shehzad plays a wristy drive to long-on
KP drives away from the body and swishes the ball to cover
full and outside off, gets forward and plays it back to Narine
looks like a seam-up quick fizzer, punched down the ground to long-on
full and outside off, driven on the front foot to cover. Front-foot no-ball called by umpire Dar
full-toss on off, cracked to mid-off

chopped on. Too close to the off stump for the cut although the length was short enough for the shot. Shehzad flashes his hands at the ball and ends up dragging a thick inside edge back onto the stumps
Rossouw uses his feet right away and lifts this full ball over the top
back of a length on leg stump, heaved disdainfully to the midwicket boundary
Narine runs in from deep third man but the ball dies in front of him. Rossouw uses his feet and is forced to fetch this length ball. Slices an outside edge, and gets away
short of a length, backs away and cuts hard and straight to Narine at deep third man
back of a length on leg stump, beats the pull, pings the the pad and rolls to the off side
length and outside off, KP flashes an outside edge that steaks away to the third-man boundary
back of a length and outside off, slogged to leg
yorker on the leg stump, dug out
full on the leg stump, launched over long-on for a six
Rossouw flits around the crease, this is a very full ball outside leg. Picked up and whipped away behind square on the leg side. Rossouw has raced to 21 off 8 balls
starts off with a skiddy short ball outside off, KP reads the length. Goes on the back foot and chops the ball square on the off side
dragged down shorter on the leg stump, Rossouw is quick to rock back and pull to deep midwicket
fuller and slides in with the arm, KP sits back, picks off the pads and clips through square leg now
Rossouw backs away outside leg, this is a flat dart on middle. Chopped to cover
pushed through full on middle, not much spin, Rossouw aims to dink it away with a scoop. He can only toe-end the ball to the off side
shortish on the hips, pulled on the back foot through backward square leg
good length and outside off, KP winds up, unleashes a strong swing of the arms and sends the ball over the long-on boundary
flatter and quicker outside off, KP slices it to short third man
short and turns away outside off, slapped hard to sweeper cover on the back foot
good length on off stump, KP slogs but can't beat deep midwicket
Rossuw backs away outside leg, opens up the off side, and drives it inside-out to long-off
short legbreak on leg stump, Rossouw is quick to skip back and pull to deep midwicket
really full on off stump, KP drives to long-off
tossed up outside leg stump, slog-swept away to deep square leg
here comes KP. Down the track, and clouts a full-toss down the ground, beats long-on to his left. That flew to the boundary
KP uses his feet again, this time he is beaten in flight. Ends up dragging the ball over midwicket
Rossouw attacks Yasir now. He runs down the track, takes it on the half-volley, and thwacks it over midwicket for a big six. Rossouw hits the roof of the Sharjah Stadium
very full and outside off, KP laces a drive to long-off

Rossouw charges down the track and looks to loft a full ball. He gets more height rather than distance. Bhatti takes the catch at long-off. Rossouw just toe-ended it in the air. Irfan Jnr lets out an animated roar and a fist pump to boot
short of a length and outside off, KP swipes it away to deep midwicket
short on leg stump, tucks Thisara up for room. Awkwardly pulled to deep midwicket
overpitched and outside off, KP drills a drive to long-off
full and veering down leg, grazes the pad of Thisara, excellent stop from Rizwan. Excellent over from Irfan Jnr
length ball on off stump, KP smashes it away to the midwicket boundary. He has regained his touch alright
shortish and outside off, chopped to sweeper
length ball on off, Thisara looks to muscle it out of the ground. Ends up poking back to the bowler

What an unfortunate way to be dismissed. He walks off. Oh wait, KP has slid his bat in. Mute the celebrations, Lahore. Full on the stumps, hit back to the bowler. KP was straying out of the crease, backing up. Delport collects the ball and breaks the stumps. The replays suggest KP had slid his bat in time. He's safe
length ball outside off, in the slot, Perera does not get hold of the big hit. Miscues to long-off running to his left
neither short nor wide enough for the cut. Beaten outside off
very full on off, driven through the covers
very full and wide outside off, driven crisply to sweeper cover
off-stump yorker, jabbed away to sweeper cover's right
full and wide outside off, scythed away to sweeper's left
full on off stump, KP swings to long-on
might have been a googly, nudged with the spin through square leg
KP comes down the track, this short and outside off, drilled down to long-off
backs away outside leg and swishes a legbreak to long-off
dragged short on off, pulled on the back foot to long-on
quicker legbreak, turns away outside off, Sarfraz steps outside leg and cracks it square through the off side
length ball, slower possibly, Sarfraz slogs early and is hit on the pad
length and outside off, Sarfraz swings wildly again. He can't touch it
back of a length and outside off, Sarfraz connects with this and sends it clattering past cover's left
full on off stump, right up in Sarfraz's hitting arc. He holds his shape and sends the white ball flying over midwicket now
shortish on off, cramps Sarfraz for room. Dragged away to long-on
length ball outside off, KP lays into it. Lofts it stylishly over the sightscreen. 17 runs off the over. Will Baz go back to Delport again?
Sarfraz eyes up the leg side with a slog-sweep and under-edges it past the leg stump for a couple
full on the stumps, hoicked away to deep square leg
flat dart on the off stump, cramps KP for room. Miscued to cover
dropped short on off, heaved away to cow corner
KP ventures for the switch-hit, this fizzes in quickly to rap his thigh. Heading down leg? Time for a time-out
short ball on off stump, Sarfraz times the pull well. Rocks back and pulls over backward square leg
shortish and angling away outside off, stabbed to long-off
full and sliding down leg, leg-side wide
picked off the pads to square-ish long leg
slower short ball outside off, Sarfraz slogs early and sends an inside edge to short fine leg
slower short ball on leg stump, swatted to deep midwicket
Sarfraz and KP are keeping Quetta alive. Length and outside off, Sarfraz swings across the line and crashes Sohail over long-on
tossed-up offbreak on off stump, KP launches it with the spin over midwicket. That's some way to get to a fifty. Good start to the over for Quetta
back-to-back sixes off Narine. This is massive. Length ball outside off, clubbed away a long waaaaay over wide long-on. Sarfraz pumps his fist and Sir Viv is up on his feet in the Quetta dug-out
full and outside off, smeared back to the bowler. Narine sticks his left hand out and takes a stinging blow

full on off, right in the slot for Sarfraz. He dismisses it over midwicket with a powerful slog-sweep. That exploded from the middle of the bat. Sir Viv enjoyed that too. Narine under pressure, though
swished to wide long-off
short of a length on off, a back-foot punch to cover ensues. 21 off that over
full-toss on middle stump, KP hammers it over the straight boundary for another six
Sarfraz backs away outside leg, this is very full on off, not a yorker though, jammed out to sweeper cover
Irfan Jnr loses his length and loses his head. Offers another full-toss on off stump, which is clobbered over midwicket
yet another off-stump full-toss. KP goes much straighter now. Pings this over the long-on boundary. Poor death bowling from Lahore
KP seems unstoppable. Make it a hat-trick of sixes. Fractionally short and outside off, KP is quick to rock back and pull it over wide long-on. 47 off last two overs. Whoa
pitched up and outside off. Lahore are not getting their lengths right. Sarfraz backs away and merrily lifts it over cover

and Sarfraz nicks behind with his side 11 away from the target. He receives a rousing reception from the dug-out. Sarfraz backs away outside leg, this is a back of a length delivery outside off. He throws his bat at the ball and edges it behind. Carries low to Rizwan
first-ball six for Anwar. So, that is why he has been sent ahead of Mahmudullah. Full and outside off, swings through the line and hits over long-off
dragged short and outside off, uses the pace and runs it down to third man
length and outside off, Anwar Ali goes downtown again and seals victory for Quetta. Some stunning power-hitting from them at the death. Quetta move to the top of the table
